title: How to Make Potato Flattened Rice

steps.headline: Turn on the flame at medium and add in the oil.Let the oil heat-up.
Add sliced onion, chilies and garlic-ginger paste to the oil.
Add peanuts.
steps.description: Peanuts will add to the crunch of the dish.

steps.headline: Wait for two minutes and add-in the potato pieces.Cover the pan with the lid.
By  the time potato gets cooked, take the flattened rice in a dish and add water to it to make the rice soft.
steps.description: Make sure that you don't make it too soft that it gets smashed since we will be adding the flattened rice to other ingredients and mixing them up well. Alternatively you may also take the Flattened Rice in a sieve and pass water through it until they become moist to the desired extent.

steps.headline: Get back to the pan on flames.
steps.description: You should have the potato cooked well. Use a fork and try picking a potato. If the fork gets-in to the potato easily, then the potato's cooked.

steps.headline: Add salt to taste and mix well.
Once the ingredients are mixed well, add the sugar and half lemon juice and again mix it well.
Add as much coriander as available since it will only add up to the taste of the dish.
Your dish is ready!
steps.description: It should be a mix of sweet sour and crunch.

text: Turn on the flame at medium and add in the oil.Let the oil heat-up.  Add sliced onion, chilies and garlic-ginger paste to the oil.  Add peanuts. Peanuts will add to the crunch of the dish. Wait for two minutes and add-in the potato pieces.Cover the pan with the lid.  By  the time potato gets cooked, take the flattened rice in a dish and add water to it to make the rice soft. Make sure that you don't make it too soft that it gets smashed since we will be adding the flattened rice to other ingredients and mixing them up well. Alternatively you may also take the Flattened Rice in a sieve and pass water through it until they become moist to the desired extent. Get back to the pan on flames. You should have the potato cooked well. Use a fork and try picking a potato. If the fork gets-in to the potato easily, then the potato's cooked. Now add-in the flattened rice.  Add salt to taste and mix well.  Once the ingredients are mixed well, add the sugar and half lemon juice and again mix it well.  Add as much coriander as available since it will only add up to the taste of the dish. Mix well again. Your dish is ready! It should be a mix of sweet sour and crunch.
